official-title.#text:
To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the
		  outreach activities of the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other
		  purposes.

header.#text:
Outreach
				activities: cooperative activities with States; grants to States for
				improvement of outreach

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to
				State and county veterans agencies to carry out programs in locations within
				the respective jurisdictions of such agencies that offer a high probability of
				improving outreach and assistance to veterans, and to the spouses, children,
				and parents of veterans, to ensure that such individuals are fully informed
				about, and assisted in applying for, any veterans’ and veterans-related
				benefits and programs (including State veterans’ programs) for which they may
				be eligible.

In the case of a State or county
				veterans agency that is a recipient of a grant under this subsection that does

No portion of any grant awarded under
				this subsection may be used for the purposes of administering the grant funds
				or to subsidize the salaries of State or county veterans service officers or
				other employees of a State or county veterans agency that receives a grant
				under this subsection.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and shall be used to expand existing outreach
				programs and services and not to supplant State and local funding that is
				otherwise available.

text.#text:
Federal funds provided to a State or
				county veterans agency under this subsection may not be used to provide more
				than 50 percent of the total cost of the State or county government activities
				described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall give priority to State and county veterans
				agencies that serve the largest populations of veterans.

text.#text:
In awarding grants under this
				subsection, the

In a case in which a
				county government does not have a county veterans agency, the county government
				may be awarded a grant under this subsection to establish such an
				agency.

In a case in which a county
				government does not have a county veterans agency and does not seek to
				establish such an agency through the use of a grant under this subsection, the
				State veterans agency for the State in which the county is located may use a
				grant under this section to provide outreach services for that county.

In the case of a State in which no
				State or county veterans agency seeks to receive a grant under this subsection,
				the funds that would otherwise be allocated for that State shall be reallocated
				to those States in which county veterans agencies exist and have sought grants
				under this subsection.

and, for

text.#text:
A grant under this subsection may be
				used to provide education and training, including on-the-job training, for
				State, county, and local government employees who provide (or when trained will
				provide) veterans outreach services in order for those employees to obtain
				accreditation in accordance with procedures approved by the

For
				the purposes of this section:

term.#tail:
means the element of the government of a
				State that has responsibility for programs and activities of that State
				government relating to veterans benefits.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail:
means the element of the government of a
				county or municipality that has responsibility for programs and activities of
				that county or municipal government relating to veterans benefits.
